name: The Jeremiah Inn Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We went to visit friends in Tucson and sightsee. Stayed at Jeremiah Inn because we didn't want to impose and because we wanted to be on the outskirts of the city, on the edge of the open desert. The inn fulfilled our wishes, and was more than comfortable. It is situated with a fine view desert and mountains and close to many tourist attractions, including Mt. Lemmon. We hope to stay again. Our hosts were more than accommodating and helpful and the breakfasts were fabulous. The room was spacious and comfortable. The only negative: they didn't get the TV channel that carried our SF Giants in the World Series so we had to watch at our friends'. That turned out to be a plus as they enjoyed the Series, too. We weren't there to watch TV anyway! Highly recommended!
reviews.title: A fine desert spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Jeremiah Inn was outstanding and we highly recommend it. It's a beautiful, modern, immaculately clean, one-story bed-and-breakfast out in the desert, and Bob and Beth are the nicest, most helpful hosts you could imagine. Wonderful, healthy breakfasts kept us filled up till dinner, plus Beth gives you a little packet of homemade cookies everyday for later. The inn is located about half an hour out of central downtown Tucson, but well worth it for the beauty, peace, and quiet. Beautiful views of desert terrain and mountains. Large rooms, super comfy beds, couch and table; swimming pool and spa outside. We could hear howling coyotes in the distance at night, which we loved. Very, very nice, very restful. We did several day outings that we would recommend--the Desert Museum, Sabino Canyon (take the tram up, walk down), the DeGrazia Museum in the Sun, the drive up Mt. Lemmon. (Much more we didn't have time to see.) Would go back to Jeremiah Inn in a heartbeat! Thank you, Bob and Beth, for the wonderful, peaceful retreat you have created.
reviews.title: Jeremiah Inn is Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --Bob and Bev from California
reviews.title: Friendly, Comfortable, Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment the door opened, we felt right at home at this B&B. Beth and Bob are fantastic hosts who are dedicated to making you feel comfortable and well taken care of. They took a genuine interest in our trip aspirations and Bob was able to give us great advice on local restaurants and attractions.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This B&B is right on the doorstep to Mount Lemmon. As a road cyclist, there could be no better location - I rode to the top of Lemmon right from the B&B! The breakfast was delicious and tastefully presented. Oh, and the coffee --- very good too. I would say the web site does not do justice to the amazing backyard view (we ate on the patio) and the quality of the interior rooms too. Super clean and well organized. After staying here once, it is a complete no-brainer to know where we will stay on our next trip to Tucson.
reviews.title: A Fabulous Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our primary reason to choose the Jeremiah was the fact, that kids are welcome. Not so common with B&B`s, unfortunately.
reviews.title: What a wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise it was !
reviews.title: Jeremiah Inn - perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our hosts have been utmost friendly and helpful, the room very spacious, very tasteful decorated. a delicious 3 course breakfast served, the setting at the footsteps of the Catalina mountains just beautiful ....what else can you ask for ?
reviews.title: Cyclists take note

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Within 10 to 15 minutes one can reach the center of Tucson or a National Park, but there
reviews.title: A Great time staying at the Jeremiah Inn B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: is no traffic noise at night, you can see the stars blinking and occasionally you can listen
reviews.title: Great place near the mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Last weekend we took a couple of days off to go to Tucson a couple of days before my husbands meeting on Sunday morning. We flew in from Seattle late Thursday and arrived at Jeremiah Inn just before 10 PM. Bob and Beth we waiting for our arrival and could not be more gracious hosts. We immediately were made to feel at home and Beth set about finding out what foods we couldn't eat at breakfast, what time would be like to eat, etc. They then took us to our room. Our daughter and her fiance were to arrive from Phoenix the next evening and Beth was ready for them as well.
reviews.title: Peace & Quiet at the foot of the Catalina Mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hospitality was nothing short of excellent
reviews.title: Peace in the Desert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast for each of the three mornings we were there had variety as well a a nice selection of freshly sliced fruit and a small yogurt parfait to start our breakfast out and you had the option to dine inside in the diningroom or outside on the patio under the Catalina Mountains.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to relax!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was quiet during our stay, no light pollution from the city so you're able to see the constellations very easily. We were able to see Mars, Venus and Jupiter (I believe I have the last to correct).
reviews.title: Only good things to say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hiked Sabino Canyon on Friday and Bear Creek Canyon on Saturday and had a blast. Even though I was a bit under the weather. It was an AWESOME time at Jeremiah Inn and the surrounding area. GREAT Coffee too and if you're nice Bob will let you know his secret!
reviews.title: The rest of the story...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a gem of a B and B. Let’s start with the basics. The Jeremiah Inn is in a great location both scenically (at the foot of the Catalinas)and geographically. In NE Tucson but well within day trip range to Tubac, Tombstone, Bisbee etc., and of course close to many of restaurants and entertainment that Tucson has to offer. The spotless, comfortable and well appointed rooms (non connecting with another - so guaranteed quiet), together with the beautifully prepared and presented breakfasts ensure a relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Jeremiah Inn ticks all the boxes - and more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However what really makes this special is the exceptional hospitality of the owners Bob and Beth Miner. This goes well above mere professional concern and is a genuine desire to accommodate your every need and make your stay special. Advice and practical help on places to visit, free sodas and fresh cookies every day are just a few examples of how this concern for your welfare and enjoyment manifests itself.
reviews.title: A Diamond in the Desert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The consistent plaudits over the years speak for themselves. They are well deserved. Can’t wait for the next visit!
reviews.title: Wonderful owners and perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! The Jeremiah Inn is truly a wonderful place to stay if you are visiting Tucson. The Catalina Mountain view is amazing. The location is perfect. It is sort of off the beaten path but not too far if you want to see the many sights in Tucson. Believe me when I say, we didn't miss much!! We spent 5 nights with Beth and Bob and they made us feel as if we were relatives visiting for the week. They are so warm and gracious and truly want to make your stay enjoyable. Breakfast (a good deal of attention went into each day's offering---DELICIOUS!!) was served on the patio by the pool and spa. Fresh baked cookies ready to sustain you on your days adventure were packaged and ready each morning. We have stayed in B & B's in Northern Arizona, California, and New Mexico but have never met hosts who were so caring and friendly or made you feel so welcome. We will definitely be visiting again. Thank you Beth and Bob!
reviews.title: Road Trip through Arizona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Beth and Bob are such genuine people who obviously love their role as hosts of this exceptional B&B. Warm and welcoming, they are experts on the Tucson area, and they are willing to go the extra mile for their guest's comfort.
reviews.title: First Trip to Tuscon

description: Welcoming guests since 1995, on 3.3 acres of rich desert life, matched only by spacious accommodations and gracious service, Jeremiah Inn offers peaceful and quiet lodging with delightful fresh cooked breakfasts and spectacular views of the Catalina Mountains. Amenities include home baked cookies, complimentary sodas and bottled water, pool (seasonal), whirlpool, guest laundry, guest refrigerator, robes, wi fi, TV, hairdryer. Hiking, biking, birding, golf, and restaurants nearby.
